channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: Stabilizing Cobalt Markets: A Price Floor for U.S. Minerals Security
item.description: U.S. cobalt security is threatened by severe price volatility driven by PRC oversupply, which has pushed Western mines—including the only U.S. cobalt mine—offline. The United States should use a price floor for strategic projects needed for national and economic security.

item.title: Experts React: The NSS and Washington’s New Approach to the Western Hemisphere
item.description: CSIS Americas experts weigh in on the implications of the U.S. National Security Strategy for the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: Navigating the Divide: Why the U.S. Navy Must Resume FONOPs in Indonesia
item.description: For nearly a decade, the U.S. has quietly acquiesced to Indonesia’s restrictive maritime claims to avoid diplomatic friction. This policy has failed. To prevent a catastrophic loss of access during a future crisis, the U.S. Navy must resume targeted Freedom of Navigation Operations.

item.title: Progress at the Much-Delayed New Yalu River Bridge
item.description: Satellite imagery shows that North Korea has made significant progress at the port-of-entry site for the much-delayed New Yalu River Bridge.

item.title: Why Did the United States Seize a Venezuelan Oil Shipment?
item.description: By itself, the U.S. seizure of a Venezuelan oil cargo won’t rattle oil markets. But it likely signals a new commitment to sanctions enforcement that will complicate “shadow fleet” operations and ratchet up the pressure on Maduro to step aside.

item.title: Protecting Subsea Cables: Detect to Deter, Sue to Secure
item.description: Subsea cables power global commerce. Though rare, cable attacks impose real costs. But leading technologies are democratizing maritime data and deterring would-be saboteurs. To further deter intentional cable attacks, cable owners should aggressively pursue legal remedies.

item.title: Breaking the Debt Trap: Why Spending Smarter Beats Spending More
item.description: In this commentary, Philip Luck and Michael H. Gary argue efficient public spending is the key to unlocking growth in challenging fiscal environments characterized by rising debt and slowing growth.

item.title: Creeping Sovereignty: What is China Building in the Yellow Sea (West Sea?) | Explainer Video
item.description: What is China building in the area in and around […]

item.title: What Does the Development Finance Corporation Reauthorization Mean for Energy?
item.description: Congress is set to reauthorize the DFC through 2031, with potentially significant implications for U.S. energy strategy.

item.title: Targeting State AI Laws Undermines, Rather than Advances, U.S. Technology Leadership
item.description: Aalok Mehta examines President Trump’s new executive order targeting state AI laws, arguing that preempting state legislation before a federal framework exists risks public trust, slows AI adoption, and undermines U.S. technology leadership globally.
